Name: Coptic textile
Description: Textile, lanceolate in shape, from the vertices of which two stalks are emerging, the upper one clipped. Both are decorated with a stylised vegetal volute.The longest one ends in a trefoil. The lanceolate part is decorated with a border of stylised vine leaves. On the inside, there are interlacements forming eight pointed stars, in the centres of which there are rectangulars forming a reticle. The decoration is made with the flying spool technique.
